intro: Loasa barneoudii, commonly known as the yellow loasa, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and palmately lobed leaves. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Loasa barneoudii is often found in canyons and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
